label: Description
value: Cartoon showing other fantastical means of surface and air transportation than are seen in -84, including a balloon brigade, and a roasting spit with fire provided from Mount Etna. Below, title and publisher's name.

value: Engraving, brush and watercolor on paper

value: Corner of a flower bed, with a bird's nest containing three (thrush's?) eggs. At left, a basket with some tuberous plants in it for transplanting. Publisher's name, lower right corner.

value: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Valence shaped piece and three fragments, printed by plate with color added by block; design: "Toilet of Venus". A) Valence shows a canopy in red and blue, below which is part of scene of Venus and attendants. Other fragments show mill, landscape detail, part of temple. Probably Nantes.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave; block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: A rectangular fragment of woven wool and linen on an undyed linen backing. Design shows brown ground with with white vines forming diamonds, enclosing Coptic crosses. At bottom, a polychrome border of interlocking shapes.

label: Description
value: Corner of exterior of one of the exposition buildings set among tall pine trees.

label: Description
value: Square wood block for printing handkerchiefs. Set with design in metal of rosettes and arches.

label: Description
value: Red and green rectangular panel of silk. White rectangular border around the green separates it from the surrounding red. The gold printing (prada technique) makes use of the "tumpal" motif (row of isosceles triangles) and other geometric and floral shapes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: tied resist, stitched resist (tritik), and printed with metallic pigments(prada)

label: Description
value: Long panel, possibly a breast cloth (kemben), made of two wide borders, showing rows of rich gold brocading. Border shows "tumpal" motif (row of isosceles triangles) plus stylized floral and vegetable design. Ground woven in dark blue silk, with occasional red silk thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Festival sarong worn by women, of woven stripes in dark brown, coral, dark blue, and natural color. Ornamented with embroidery and pieces of mica attached in vertical rows.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, mica Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Woven striped sarong in brown, light brown, cream-white, and blue. Embroidered in an all-over pattern of alternating geometric, organic patterned, and plain stripes with mica pieces added.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, mica Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Two breadths of cotton joined in center. Black center area showing a fine red stripe running through. On either side is a wide border woven in yellow, black, and gold in a geometric (patola-inspired) design.

label: Physical description
value: Meidum: silk, cotton, metallic threads Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Ulos ragidup, 'the cloth with the pattern of life', is a large ceremonial selendang (shoulder cloth) which is wrapped around the groom's mother by the bride's father at a wedding. Center area in dark maroon with vertical stripes of light blue and a bright red-brown. Ornamented on either end with intricate insets of cream color with horizontal bands of design, by making use of one additional warp. Wide borders in dark red, with a narrow stripe of dark blue on outer-most side and a stripe showing a geometric pattern in gold on the inner most side (touching the center panel), run the length of the piece on both sides of the center panel. Woven in three sections and fringed.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: tied resist patterning in warp or weft (ikat) on plain weave, with supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Short jacket with long sleeves. Woven in stripes of dark blue, orange and red. Back and neck opening elaborately decorated with mica and small shells.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, mica, shells Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Silk patola with tied resist pattern in purple and yellow showing vertical lines and central pattern of diamonds and stars with border of diamonds and hearts. Stripes run parallel to selvage on either side. Fringe at top and bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: tied resist patterning in warp (ikat) on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 254 x 81.3 cm (8 ft. 4 in. x 32 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1961: Alan L. Wolfe; 1961: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Large sarong (kain panjang), batik in dark blue, showing diamond-shaped all-over pattern. Small border band on either side showing a grid-work pattern interrupted by squares. Piece painted with gold (prada technique) in lower regions leaving top free for handling and folding.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave; painted with metallic pigments (prada)

label: Description
value: Fragment of a narrow border pattern. Red silk with design of lozenge shapes in flat silver foil strips.

label: Description
value: Square of woven textile  in dark purple wool and undyed linen. The design shows  a water-fowl within a circle and square. Border of quatrefoils, scrolls and  dots. The square has been mounted onto another piece of undyed woven linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: tapestry eave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1961: Alan L. Wolfe; 1961: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Silk textile, probably a shoulder cloth (selendang) or breast cloth (kemben), with all-over geometric pattern ("ceplokkan" motif) in dark brown and cream-white. Outer edge decorated with narrow border similar to the running-key design. Fringed.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Long sarong (kain panjang) in blue and white batik, showing a stylized all-over floral pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Batik textile, probably a shoulder cloth (selendang) or breast cloth (kemben) in dark blue, brown, and cream-white. Shows an all-over pattern of the "ship of the dead" motif, stylized and abstracted yet bearing its original meaning.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Cotton square, possibly a head cloth (kain kepala), showing a "wayang" figure (a puppet acting out the heroic poem of the Mahabharata, describing the battle between Rama, God-hero, and the demons of Rawana) encircled in the center. All four corners ornamented with the stupa motif. Colors: black, brown, and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Long batik sarong (kain panjang) in dark blue, dark brown, and light brown on cream-colored ground. Shows the "semen" motif of leaves, flowers, and plants evenly covering the cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Batik sarong in red, blue, yellow, and cream color. Shows an all-over "banji" motif (swastika variation) with butterflies around a large-scale floral pattern ("buketan" motif), at intervals. Scalloped floral borders (a North Javanese batik innovation) within another border.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Batik sarong in brown, pink, and dark blue. Dark blue seaweed pattern placed freely over the pink-brown ground in the body or 'badan' of the piece. The head or 'kepala' (broad band with different coloring and pattern than remainder) shows dark ground with floral pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Red and blue batik sarong. Shows "ceplokkan" pattern: flowers or blossoms, symmetrically distributed over surface, stylized, star-like,and contained within a geometric shape. Borders show batiked on fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Large silk shoulder cloth, colored by resist method known as tritik, in red, orange, green and natural.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: stitch-resist (tritik) on plain weave

label: Description
value: tied-resist dyed silk textile with a field filled with diamond shapes, border of large dots with guard borders of smaller dots. In red, orange and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: tied-resist patterning on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1961: Alan L. Wolfe; 1961: acquired by the Museum.
